message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a new blockchain architecture that aims to improve the throughput of existing blockchains by separating the process of consensus on the transaction order from transaction computation. This makes it likely that the paper belongs to the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses security concerns and the roles of different nodes in the pipeline, which suggests that it could also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of heterogeneity in nodes, which could make it relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the lifecycle of transactions and the safety and liveness of the system, which could make it relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
